question_text:
An aqueous solution containing 7.60 g of lead(II) nitrate is
added to an aqueous solution containing 7.39 g of potassium
chloride. If the percent yield is 84.0%, how many grams of
excess reagent remain after the reaction is complete?
A. 5.66 g
B. 4.50 g
C. 3.33 g
D. 0.0604 g
solution_text:
An aqueous solution containing 7.60 g of lead(II) nitrate is
added to an aqueous solution containing 7.39 g of potassium
chloride. If the percent yield is 84.0%, how many grams of
excess reagent remain after the reaction is complete?
Pb(NO ) (aq) + 2KCl(aq) ➔ PbCl (s) + 2KNO (aq)
3 2 2 3
Pb(NOP)b(NO ) (aq) + 2KCl(aq) ➔ PbCKlC(ls) + 2KNO (aq)
3 2 3 2 2 3
7.6 g /(331.12 g/n) = 0.023 moles 7.39 g /(74.55g/n) = 0.099 moles
0.023 n x (1/1) = 0.023 moles PbCl 0.099 n x (1/2) = 0.0495 moles PbCl
2 2
Moles KCl reacted = 0.023 x (2/1) x (84%/100%) = 0.0386 moles
Excess KCl (moles) = 0.099 moles - 0.0386 moles = 0.0604 moles
Excess KCl (grams) = 0.0604moles x (74.55 g/mol) = 4.50 grams KCl

4 3
➔ CuS(s) + Li+ (aq) + NO (aq)
3
B. Li+(aq) + S-(aq) + Cu+(aq) + NO -(aq)
3
➔ CuS(s) + LiNO (aq)
3
C. 2Li+(aq) + S2-(aq) + Cu2+(aq) + 2NO -(aq)
3
➔ Cu2+(aq) + S2-(aq) + 2LiNO (s)
3

3

3
Complete Ionic Equation:
contains the solids and ALL the ionic species

All NH + and NO - ion salts are soluble so any species with
4 3

question_text:
Consider the decomposition of calcium carbonate to form
calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. If the reaction produced
732 mL of CO at 21°C and 77.1 cm Hg, how many grams of
2
CaO are produced?
A. 0.21 g
B. 1.73 g
C. 1.86 g
D. 3.10 g
E. 17.2 g
solution_text:
Consider the decomposition of calcium carbonate to form
calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. If the reaction produced
732 mL of CO at 21°C and 77.1 cm Hg, how many grams of
2
CaO are produced?
1 CaCO (s) ➔ CaO(s) + CO (g)
3 2
A. 0.21 g
77.1 cm Hg = 1.01 atm
B. 1.73 g
2 PV = nRT 21°C = 294 K
C. 1.86 g
n = PV/RT
D. 3.10 g
= (1.01 atm)(0.732L)/(0.082 L-atm/mol-K)(294 K)
E. 17.2 g
= 0.031 moles
1:1 mole ratio
3
0.031 moles CaO
0.031 moles CaO x 56.08 g/mol
4
= 1.73 grams

A = Combustion (reaction with oxygen)
B = Synthesis (combining things)
C = Decomposition (breaking down)
D = Double displacement (swapping ions)
